# OS MCQ Sheet (230 Questions) — With Explanations

**Format:** Question → Options (A–D) → Correct Option → Explanation

---

## Q1. Time for sector to rotate under head is?

A. Seek Time  
B. Transfer Time  
C. Rotational Latency  
D. Response Time  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Rotation delay.

## Q2. Logical address is generated by

A. Disk  
B. MMU  
C. CPU  
D. Memory  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Virtual address.

## Q3. Fragmentation inside a partition is called?

A. Compaction  
B. External Fragmentation  
C. Swapping  
D. Internal Fragmentation  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Wasted space inside allocated block.

## Q4. Short-term scheduler is also called

A. Job Scheduler  
B. Dispatcher  
C. Swapper  
D. CPU Scheduler  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Selects process for CPU.

## Q5. A thread shares with other threads of same process:

A. Stack and Registers  
B. Stack only  
C. Program Counter  
D. Code section, data section, OS resources  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Threads share address space but have own stack/registers.

## Q6. The first process in Linux is

A. sched  
B. init / systemd  
C. swapper  
D. root  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** PID 1.

## Q7. Root directory is found at?

A. Start of file  
B. In RAM  
C. Fixed location on disk  
D. Random location  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Known location.

## Q8. Semaphore 'wait' operation

A. Sets to 0  
B. Increments value  
C. Sets to 1  
D. Decrements value  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** wait/P decrements.

## Q9. PCB stands for

A. Process Control Block  
B. Process Communication Block  
C. Program Control Block  
D. Program Counter Block  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Stores process state.

## Q10. File control block (FCB) contains?

A. File attributes  
B. Process state  
C. Page table  
D. CPU registers  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Metadata about file.

## Q11. Time to move disk arm to cylinder is

A. Transfer Time  
B. Seek Time  
C. Rotational Latency  
D. Access Time  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Arm movement time.

## Q12. File control block (FCB) contains

A. CPU registers  
B. Page table  
C. Process state  
D. File attributes  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Metadata about file.

## Q13. Deadlock prevention ensures?

A. Detection  
B. All conditions hold  
C. At least one condition doesn't hold  
D. Safe state  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Breaks one of the 4 conditions.

## Q14. Resource Allocation Graph with a cycle implies deadlock if?

A. Multiple instances  
B. Always  
C. No resources  
D. Single instance per resource type  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Cycle + Single instance = Deadlock.

## Q15. Which is a shell?

A. Kernel  
B. Bash  
C. GCC  
D. Gnome  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Command line interpreter.

## Q16. Which program runs at all times on the computer?

A. Kernel  
B. Loader  
C. Compiler  
D. Editor  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Kernel is the core of OS.

## Q17. Resource Allocation Graph with a cycle implies deadlock if

A. Multiple instances  
B. Single instance per resource type  
C. Always  
D. No resources  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Cycle + Single instance = Deadlock.

## Q18. Working Set Model is used to prevent

A. Deadlock  
B. Thrashing  
C. Fragmentation  
D. Starvation  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Estimates locality.

## Q19. User-level threads are managed by?

A. Hardware  
B. CPU  
C. Thread library  
D. Kernel  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Managed in user space.

## Q20. File control block (FCB) contains

A. CPU registers  
B. File attributes  
C. Page table  
D. Process state  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Metadata about file.

## Q21. Short-term scheduler is also called

A. Dispatcher  
B. Swapper  
C. CPU Scheduler  
D. Job Scheduler  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Selects process for CPU.

## Q22. In a system with 2 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if?

A. Wait  
B. Never (1 resource)  
C. Cycle exists  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q23. The first process in Linux is

A. root  
B. swapper  
C. init / systemd  
D. sched  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** PID 1.

## Q24. Critical Section is code where

A. Private resources are accessed  
B. No resources accessed  
C. Shared resources are accessed  
D. I/O occurs  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Needs mutual exclusion.

## Q25. Working Set Model is used to prevent?

A. Fragmentation  
B. Thrashing  
C. Deadlock  
D. Starvation  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Estimates locality.

## Q26. Which program runs at all times on the computer?

A. Kernel  
B. Editor  
C. Loader  
D. Compiler  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Kernel is the core of OS.

## Q27. Logical address is generated by

A. MMU  
B. CPU  
C. Memory  
D. Disk  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Virtual address.

## Q28. Turnaround time equals

A. Completion Time - Arrival Time  
B. Waiting + Burst  
C. Burst - Waiting  
D. Exit - Entry  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Total time in system.

## Q29. In Unix, 'fork()' system call creates

A. File  
B. Child process  
C. Thread  
D. Pipe  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Clones parent process.

## Q30. The first process in Linux is

A. sched  
B. init / systemd  
C. root  
D. swapper  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** PID 1.

## Q31. Resource Allocation Graph with a cycle implies deadlock if?

A. No resources  
B. Single instance per resource type  
C. Always  
D. Multiple instances  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Cycle + Single instance = Deadlock.

## Q32. In a system with 4 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if

A. Cycle exists  
B. Hold and wait  
C. Wait  
D. Never (1 resource)  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q33. Semaphore 'signal' operation

A. Decrements value  
B. Sets to 0  
C. Checks value  
D. Increments value  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** signal/V increments.

## Q34. In a system with 2 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if

A. Wait  
B. Never (1 resource)  
C. Cycle exists  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q35. In a system with 2 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if?

A. Cycle exists  
B. Wait  
C. Never (1 resource)  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q36. Command to list files

A. ls  
B. list  
C. dir  
D. show  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Basic Unix command.

## Q37. Time for sector to rotate under head is?

A. Response Time  
B. Seek Time  
C. Rotational Latency  
D. Transfer Time  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Rotation delay.

## Q38. Demand paging brings page into memory

A. Randomly  
B. Never  
C. At start  
D. Only when needed  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Lazy loading.

## Q39. Time to move disk arm to cylinder is

A. Rotational Latency  
B. Seek Time  
C. Transfer Time  
D. Access Time  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Arm movement time.

## Q40. In a system with 4 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if

A. Wait  
B. Cycle exists  
C. Hold and wait  
D. Never (1 resource)  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q41. Fragmentation inside a partition is called

A. External Fragmentation  
B. Compaction  
C. Internal Fragmentation  
D. Swapping  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Wasted space inside allocated block.

## Q42. Dining Philosophers problem illustrates?

A. Paging  
B. Memory issues  
C. Scheduling  
D. Synchronization issues  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Classic concurrency problem.

## Q43. Effective Access Time (EAT) depends on

A. Monitor size  
B. Printer speed  
C. Disk size  
D. Page fault rate  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Faults add massive overhead.

## Q44. Resource Allocation Graph with a cycle implies deadlock if

A. No resources  
B. Multiple instances  
C. Always  
D. Single instance per resource type  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Cycle + Single instance = Deadlock.

## Q45. Which is NOT a necessary condition for deadlock?

A. Circular Wait  
B. Preemption  
C. Mutual Exclusion  
D. Hold and Wait  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** No-preemption is the condition.

## Q46. In a system with 2 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if

A. Never (1 resource)  
B. Wait  
C. Cycle exists  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q47. Bootstrap program is stored in?

A. Cache  
B. RAM  
C. Hard Disk  
D. ROM  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** ROM/BIOS initializes hardware.

## Q48. Which is NOT a necessary condition for deadlock?

A. Hold and Wait  
B. Mutual Exclusion  
C. Circular Wait  
D. Preemption  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** No-preemption is the condition.

## Q49. Time to move disk arm to cylinder is

A. Rotational Latency  
B. Seek Time  
C. Access Time  
D. Transfer Time  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Arm movement time.

## Q50. Context switching is handled by?

A. Compiler  
B. Dispatcher  
C. Shell  
D. Scheduler  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Dispatcher loads selected process.

## Q51. Which is a shell?

A. Gnome  
B. Bash  
C. Kernel  
D. GCC  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Command line interpreter.

## Q52. A thread shares with other threads of same process:?

A. Stack only  
B. Program Counter  
C. Stack and Registers  
D. Code section, data section, OS resources  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Threads share address space but have own stack/registers.

## Q53. Turnaround time equals?

A. Exit - Entry  
B. Completion Time - Arrival Time  
C. Waiting + Burst  
D. Burst - Waiting  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Total time in system.

## Q54. System calls provide interface between

A. User and monitor  
B. Process and OS  
C. CPU and Memory  
D. User and hardware  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** System calls request OS services.

## Q55. User-level threads are managed by?

A. CPU  
B. Hardware  
C. Kernel  
D. Thread library  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Managed in user space.

## Q56. Dining Philosophers problem illustrates

A. Scheduling  
B. Paging  
C. Memory issues  
D. Synchronization issues  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Classic concurrency problem.

## Q57. Which is NOT an operating system?

A. Oracle  
B. Windows  
C. Android  
D. Linux  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Oracle is a database.

## Q58. The first process in Linux is?

A. swapper  
B. sched  
C. root  
D. init / systemd  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** PID 1.

## Q59. Context switching is handled by?

A. Scheduler  
B. Dispatcher  
C. Compiler  
D. Shell  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Dispatcher loads selected process.

A. Dispatcher  
B. CPU Scheduler  
C. Swapper  
D. Job Scheduler  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Selects process for CPU.

A. Wait  
B. Cycle exists  
C. Never (1 resource)  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q62. Context switching is handled by

A. Compiler  
B. Dispatcher  
C. Scheduler  
D. Shell  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Dispatcher loads selected process.

## Q63. Waiting time equals

A. Response - Arrival  
B. Turnaround Time - Burst Time  
C. Burst + I/O  
D. Completion - Arrival  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Time spent in ready queue.

## Q64. Which is NOT a necessary condition for deadlock?

A. Circular Wait  
B. Preemption  
C. Mutual Exclusion  
D. Hold and Wait  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** No-preemption is the condition.

## Q65. File control block (FCB) contains

A. Page table  
B. File attributes  
C. Process state  
D. CPU registers  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Metadata about file.

A. root  
B. sched  
C. init / systemd  
D. swapper  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** PID 1.

A. User and hardware  
B. Process and OS  
C. CPU and Memory  
D. User and monitor  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** System calls request OS services.

## Q68. File control block (FCB) contains

A. File attributes  
B. CPU registers  
C. Page table  
D. Process state  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Metadata about file.

## Q69. Demand paging brings page into memory

A. Never  
B. Randomly  
C. At start  
D. Only when needed  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Lazy loading.

## Q70. Swap space resides on?

A. ROM  
B. Cache  
C. RAM  
D. Disk  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Backing store for swapped pages.

## Q71. Long-term scheduler controls

A. Context switch  
B. CPU usage  
C. Degree of multiprogramming  
D. I/O speed  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Controls number of processes in memory.

## Q72. Command to list files?

A. show  
B. list  
C. dir  
D. ls  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Basic Unix command.

## Q73. In a system with 2 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if

A. Wait  
B. Never (1 resource)  
C. Cycle exists  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q74. Which program runs at all times on the computer?

A. Editor  
B. Loader  
C. Compiler  
D. Kernel  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Kernel is the core of OS.

## Q75. Root directory is found at?

A. Fixed location on disk  
B. Start of file  
C. In RAM  
D. Random location  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Known location.

A. Bash  
B. Kernel  
C. GCC  
D. Gnome  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Command line interpreter.

## Q77. A thread shares with other threads of same process:

A. Program Counter  
B. Stack and Registers  
C. Stack only  
D. Code section, data section, OS resources  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Threads share address space but have own stack/registers.

## Q78. In a system with 8 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if?

A. Wait  
B. Cycle exists  
C. Hold and wait  
D. Never (1 resource)  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q79. Command to list files

A. show  
B. ls  
C. dir  
D. list  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Basic Unix command.

## Q80. A safe state implies?

A. Starvation  
B. Deadlock  
C. No deadlock  
D. Crash  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Safe sequence guarantees completion.

## Q81. Effective Access Time (EAT) depends on?

A. Printer speed  
B. Monitor size  
C. Page fault rate  
D. Disk size  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Faults add massive overhead.

## Q82. Which directory structure allows sharing?

A. Tree  
B. Two Level  
C. Single Level  
D. Acyclic Graph Directory  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Allows links/aliases.

## Q83. In a system with 8 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if?

A. Cycle exists  
B. Wait  
C. Never (1 resource)  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q84. Short-term scheduler is also called

A. CPU Scheduler  
B. Job Scheduler  
C. Swapper  
D. Dispatcher  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Selects process for CPU.

## Q85. Page fault occurs when

A. I/O complete  
B. Page is not in memory  
C. Page is in memory  
D. Process terminates  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Hardware trap.

## Q86. Logical address is generated by?

A. MMU  
B. Disk  
C. Memory  
D. CPU  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Virtual address.

## Q87. Semaphore 'wait' operation

A. Increments value  
B. Decrements value  
C. Sets to 1  
D. Sets to 0  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** wait/P decrements.

A. Response - Arrival  
B. Turnaround Time - Burst Time  
C. Burst + I/O  
D. Completion - Arrival  

> **Correct Option: B**

A. Wait  
B. Cycle exists  
C. Never (1 resource)  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

B. dir

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Basic Unix command.

## Q94. Page size is usually a power of?

A. 2  
B. 10  
C. 3  
D. 5  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Hardware addressing convenience.

## Q95. SSTF algorithm selects request

A. Random  
B. Furthest away  
C. First in queue  
D. Closest to current head position  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Minimizes seek time locally.

## Q96. Which solves external fragmentation?

A. Slicing  
B. Paging  
C. Compaction  
D. Segmentation  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Shuffles memory to merge holes.

## Q97. Demand paging brings page into memory?

A. At start  
B. Only when needed  
C. Never  
D. Randomly  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Lazy loading.

## Q98. Working Set Model is used to prevent

A. Deadlock  
B. Thrashing  
C. Fragmentation  
D. Starvation  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Estimates locality.

A. Never (1 resource)  
B. Cycle exists  
C. Wait  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

> **Correct Option: D**

## Q103. Mode bit 0 usually indicates

A. Kernel Mode  
B. Safe Mode  
C. User Mode  
D. Sleep Mode  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** 0 is Kernel/Monitor mode.

## Q106. Which solves external fragmentation?

A. Segmentation  
B. Paging  
C. Compaction  
D. Slicing  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Shuffles memory to merge holes.

D. Paging

## Q109. MMU maps?

A. Logical to Physical address  
B. Page to Frame  
C. Frame to Page  
D. Physical to Logical  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Hardware unit for mapping.

## Q123. Working Set Model is used to prevent?

A. Starvation  
B. Deadlock  
C. Fragmentation  
D. Thrashing  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Estimates locality.

## Q124. Which program runs at all times on the computer?

A. Loader  
B. Compiler  
C. Kernel  
D. Editor  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Kernel is the core of OS.

## Q125. MMU maps

A. Page to Frame  
B. Logical to Physical address  
C. Frame to Page  
D. Physical to Logical  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Hardware unit for mapping.

## Q126. System calls provide interface between

A. Process and OS  
B. User and monitor  
C. User and hardware  
D. CPU and Memory  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** System calls request OS services.

## Q127. Which is NOT an operating system?

A. Linux  
B. Android  
C. Oracle  
D. Windows  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Oracle is a database.

## Q128. Which program runs at all times on the computer?

A. Compiler  
B. Loader  
C. Editor  
D. Kernel  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Kernel is the core of OS.

## Q129. Root directory is found at

A. Fixed location on disk  
B. Random location  
C. Start of file  
D. In RAM  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Known location.

## Q130. Root directory is found at

A. Start of file  
B. Random location  
C. Fixed location on disk  
D. In RAM  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Known location.

## Q131. Turnaround time equals

A. Completion Time - Arrival Time  
B. Burst - Waiting  
C. Waiting + Burst  
D. Exit - Entry  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Total time in system.

## Q132. Critical Section is code where

A. No resources accessed  
B. Private resources are accessed  
C. I/O occurs  
D. Shared resources are accessed  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Needs mutual exclusion.

## Q133. Fragmentation inside a partition is called

A. Swapping  
B. External Fragmentation  
C. Internal Fragmentation  
D. Compaction  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Wasted space inside allocated block.

## Q134. Waiting time equals

A. Burst + I/O  
B. Completion - Arrival  
C. Turnaround Time - Burst Time  
D. Response - Arrival  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Time spent in ready queue.

## Q135. Which directory structure allows sharing?

A. Single Level  
B. Tree  
C. Two Level  
D. Acyclic Graph Directory  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Allows links/aliases.

## Q136. Which is NOT a necessary condition for deadlock?

A. Preemption  
B. Circular Wait  
C. Mutual Exclusion  
D. Hold and Wait  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** No-preemption is the condition.

## Q137. Mode bit 0 usually indicates?

A. Sleep Mode  
B. Safe Mode  
C. Kernel Mode  
D. User Mode  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** 0 is Kernel/Monitor mode.

## Q138. Page fault occurs when?

A. Page is not in memory  
B. Process terminates  
C. Page is in memory  
D. I/O complete  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Hardware trap.

## Q139. The first process in Linux is

A. swapper  
B. sched  
C. root  
D. init / systemd  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** PID 1.

## Q140. PCB stands for

A. Program Control Block  
B. Process Communication Block  
C. Program Counter Block  
D. Process Control Block  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Stores process state.

## Q141. Logical address is generated by

A. Memory  
B. CPU  
C. MMU  
D. Disk  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Virtual address.

## Q142. System calls provide interface between

A. User and monitor  
B. CPU and Memory  
C. User and hardware  
D. Process and OS  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** System calls request OS services.

## Q143. Demand paging brings page into memory?

A. Never  
B. Randomly  
C. Only when needed  
D. At start  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Lazy loading.

## Q144. Effective Access Time (EAT) depends on

A. Disk size  
B. Page fault rate  
C. Monitor size  
D. Printer speed  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Faults add massive overhead.

## Q145. Page fault occurs when?

A. Process terminates  
B. I/O complete  
C. Page is not in memory  
D. Page is in memory  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Hardware trap.

## Q146. User-level threads are managed by

A. Kernel  
B. Thread library  
C. Hardware  
D. CPU  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Managed in user space.

## Q147. MMU maps?

A. Page to Frame  
B. Frame to Page  
C. Physical to Logical  
D. Logical to Physical address  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Hardware unit for mapping.

## Q148. Round Robin is suitable for

A. Real-Time Systems  
B. Batch Systems  
C. Time Sharing Systems  
D. Single User  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Fair share of CPU.

## Q149. SSTF algorithm selects request

A. Furthest away  
B. First in queue  
C. Random  
D. Closest to current head position  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Minimizes seek time locally.

## Q150. Root directory is found at

A. Fixed location on disk  
B. Random location  
C. In RAM  
D. Start of file  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Known location.

B. Crash  
C. Starvation  
D. Deadlock  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Safe sequence guarantees completion.

D. Process Communication Block  

> **Correct Option: C**

A. Hold and wait  
B. Never (1 resource)  
C. Cycle exists  
D. Wait  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

D. Hold and wait

D. Scheduler  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Dispatcher loads selected process.

## Q167. Semaphore 'wait' operation

A. Sets to 1  
B. Sets to 0  
C. Decrements value  
D. Increments value  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** wait/P decrements.

## Q168. Semaphore 'signal' operation

A. Decrements value  
B. Increments value  
C. Sets to 0  
D. Checks value  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** signal/V increments.

A. GCC  
B. Kernel  
C. Bash  
D. Gnome  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Command line interpreter.

A. Response Time  
B. Transfer Time  
C. Seek Time  
D. Rotational Latency  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Rotation delay.

B. Page table  
C. File attributes  
D. Process state

## Q192. Dining Philosophers problem illustrates

A. Memory issues  
B. Synchronization issues  
C. Paging  
D. Scheduling  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Classic concurrency problem.

## Q193. Semaphore 'signal' operation

A. Degree of multiprogramming  
B. CPU usage  
C. I/O speed  
D. Context switch  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Controls number of processes in memory.

## Q196. Which directory structure allows sharing?

A. Single Level  
B. Acyclic Graph Directory  
C. Two Level  
D. Tree  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Allows links/aliases.

B. Cycle exists  
C. Never (1 resource)  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q198. Which is NOT a necessary condition for deadlock?

A. Mutual Exclusion  
B. Circular Wait  
C. Hold and Wait  
D. Preemption  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** No-preemption is the condition.

## Q199. Swap space resides on

A. RAM  
B. Cache  
C. ROM  
D. Disk  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Backing store for swapped pages.

## Q200. Waiting time equals

A. Response - Arrival  
B. Turnaround Time - Burst Time  
C. Completion - Arrival  
D. Burst + I/O  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Time spent in ready queue.

## Q201. Swap space resides on

A. ROM  
B. RAM  
C. Cache  
D. Disk  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Backing store for swapped pages.

## Q202. In a system with 2 processes and 1 resource, deadlock occurs if

A. Never (1 resource)  
B. Cycle exists  
C. Wait  
D. Hold and wait  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** 1 resource cannot cause deadlock.

## Q203. In Unix, 'fork()' system call creates?

A. Child process  
B. Thread  
C. Pipe  
D. File  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Clones parent process.

## Q204. Deadlock prevention ensures

A. All conditions hold  
B. Detection  
C. At least one condition doesn't hold  
D. Safe state  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Breaks one of the 4 conditions.

## Q205. The first process in Linux is?

A. root  
B. swapper  
C. sched  
D. init / systemd  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** PID 1.

## Q227. Resource Allocation Graph with a cycle implies deadlock if

A. No resources  
B. Multiple instances  
C. Single instance per resource type  
D. Always  

> **Correct Option: C**  
> **Explanation:** Cycle + Single instance = Deadlock.

## Q228. Which directory structure allows sharing?

A. Acyclic Graph Directory  
B. Single Level  
C. Two Level  
D. Tree  

> **Correct Option: A**  
> **Explanation:** Allows links/aliases.

## Q229. Page size is usually a power of

A. 5  
B. 10  
C. 3  
D. 2  

> **Correct Option: D**  
> **Explanation:** Hardware addressing convenience.

## Q230. Spinlock causes

A. Sleep  
B. Busy waiting  
C. Deadlock  
D. Context switch  

> **Correct Option: B**  
> **Explanation:** Process loops checking lock.
